intro: Phthirusa adunca var. orinocensis, commonly known as the Orinoco phthirusa, is a flowering plant native to South America. It belongs to the family Malvaceae and is characterized by its hairy, glandular leaves and showy, pale pink to white flowers. The plant typically grows in moist, tropical environments and is often found in wetlands or along riverbanks. Its morphology includes a woody stem with alternate, ovate leaves that have prominent veins. The species is of interest to botanists due to its unique adaptations to its wetland habitat.
